Module com.example.sudokuminiproject2
Package com.example.sudokuminiproject2.model.board

Interface IBoard

All Known Implementing Classes:
Board, BoardAdapter, GameBoard
public interface IBoard
The IBoard interface defines the essential methods and default implementations for handling the Sudoku game board, including validation of numbers by column, row, and box, as well as setting numbers and displaying the board.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    int
    getNumberByIndex(int column, int row)
    Retrieves the number located at a specific index on the Sudoku board.
    default boolean

    Validates if a number is allowed in a 2x3 sub-grid (box) according to Sudoku rules.
    default boolean
    isNumberByColumnAllowed(List<List<Integer>> board, int numberSelected, int column, int row)
    Validates if a number is allowed in the specified column according to Sudoku rules.
    default boolean
    isNumberByRowAllowed(List<List<Integer>> board, int numberSelected, int column, int row)
    Validates if a number is allowed in the specified row according to Sudoku rules.

    showIdealGame(List<List<Integer>> board)
    Displays the ideal state of the Sudoku game board as a string.

  • Method Details

    • getNumberByIndex

      int getNumberByIndex(int column, int row)
      Retrieves the number located at a specific index on the Sudoku board.
      Parameters:
      column - The column index of the board.
      row - The row index of the board.
      Returns:
      The number at the specified position.

    • showBoard

      String showBoard()
      Displays the current state of the Sudoku board as a string.
      Returns:
      A string representation of the current board.

    • isNumberByColumnAllowed

      default boolean isNumberByColumnAllowed(List<List<Integer>> board, int numberSelected, int column, int row)
      Validates if a number is allowed in the specified column according to Sudoku rules.
      Parameters:
      board - The current game board represented as a list of lists.
      numberSelected - The number being checked.
      column - The column index.
      row - The row index.
      Returns:
      true if the number is allowed in the column, false otherwise.

    • isNumberByRowAllowed

      default boolean isNumberByRowAllowed(List<List<Integer>> board, int numberSelected, int column, int row)
      Validates if a number is allowed in the specified row according to Sudoku rules.
      Parameters:
      board - The current game board represented as a list of lists.
      numberSelected - The number being checked.
      column - The column index.
      row - The row index.
      Returns:
      true if the number is allowed in the row, false otherwise.

    • setNumberByIndex

      default void setNumberByIndex(List<List<Integer>> board, int number, int column, int row)
      Sets a number at a specified index on the board.
      Parameters:
      board - The current game board represented as a list of lists.
      number - The number to set.
      column - The column index.
      row - The row index.

    • isNumberByBoxAllowed

      default boolean isNumberByBoxAllowed(List<List<Integer>> board, int numberSelected, int column, int row)
      Validates if a number is allowed in a 2x3 sub-grid (box) according to Sudoku rules.
      Parameters:
      board - The current game board represented as a list of lists.
      numberSelected - The number being checked.
      column - The column index.
      row - The row index.
      Returns:
      true if the number is allowed in the box, false otherwise.

      default String showIdealGame(List<List<Integer>> board)
      Displays the ideal state of the Sudoku game board as a string.
